intro: Veronica scutellata var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth veronica, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered with fine, smooth hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to violet flowers arranged in whorls along the stems, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged oppositely, with a slightly hairy surface. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens and borders.
